snippet: With a vote pending, Secretary of State John Kerry urged Congress not to set geographic or time limits on the campaign against the Islamic State.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry argues Congress should not rule out use of ground troops to battle Islamic State, as vote is pending on extent of United States involvement in military action against group.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and MICHAEL R. GORDON

lead_paragraph: With a vote pending, Secretary of State John Kerry urged Congress not to set geographic or time limits on the campaign against the Islamic State.

headline.main: Kerry Warns Senate Against Curbs on Fighting ISIS
headline.print_headline: Kerry Argues Not to Ban Ground Troops in Fight Against Islamic Militants

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
